content: According to the Jewish tradition, harvesting is not permitted on the Sabbath. The Torah states in Exodus 34:21, "Six days you shall work, but on the seventh day you shall rest. In plowing time and in harvest you shall rest." This verse indicates that the Sabbath is a day of rest, even during times of plowing and harvesting. In addition, the Talmud discusses the prohibition against harvesting on the Sabbath in several passages, such as Shabbat 73a and Yoma 84b. These teachings show that harvesting is not permitted on the Sabbath.
